conclusion: Objects A and B are initially in the air, while objects C, D, E, and F are on the surface. Arrows indicate A and B will move through the air to the location of C, D, E, F.
Due to gravity, when A and B are placed down at the location of C, D, E, F, they will come into contact with these objects.
The image shows objects A and B displacing objects C, D, E, F, causing the surface to sag and create a depression.
The sagging of the surface indicates that objects A and B exerted force on the surface, causing it to deform. Objects C, D, E, F are displaced under the weight of A and B.

Final answer: When objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, F, they will come into contact with these objects due to gravity, causing the surface to sag and the objects C, D, E, F to be displaced under the weight of A and B.
